description: Milk vetch (Astragalus canadensis) is an amazing species that's native to North America. This tough perennial grows well in dry, rocky soils, making it an ideal choice for creating resilient medians and green spaces in urban environments. Not only is it eye-catching with fragrant, bright violet blooms, it's also great for wildlife habitat and erosion control as well as providing food for local pollinators. With incredible drought tolerance, it preserves water, helping to reduce water bills and conserve resources during drier periods. Milk vetch is a fantastic plant for landscapes that need reliable, low-maintenance beauty.
